intro: Exallage fulva, commonly known as the golden spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling spider-like structures, hence its common name. Its leaves are typically succulent and fleshy, adapted to store water in arid environments. Exallage fulva thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
